caption: Visiting Paris October 3. All the museums have crazy long lines. So decided to go to Auteuil to see some steeplechase horse races. Getting there from the subway is about a 15 min walk from Port D’Auteuil Metro station along a beautiful park trail. The races were wonderful. Beautiful track, handsome horses. Much better than waiting in some museum line.

Attended for one of two biggest days of its race calendar and amazed how little was open in two big stands. Only ground floor in public stand of four floors. Needed to buy top Panoramique ticket to get even reasonable facilities with bar and food. View good from all stands though and racing good
Great racecourse, easy to get too. Best atmosphere!
Great location A must! But, catering is too small Less wager possibility, only pmu machines
Nice track, great views. Food stands are very overcrowded though.
Fantastic seats to watch Le Grand Steeplechase for just €17 each. A great racecourse and a wonderful day out.

Auteuil provides some of the best Jumps racing in the world. A superb course with challenging, but fair jumps, kept in tiptop condition by excellent groundsmen. Many Irish & British raiders too, compete for excellent prize money. It's buttons to get in with lots of refreshment & beverage outlets serving everything from crepes to hotdogs. The  Paris Mutual (Tote) has lots of different outlets depending on the type of bet & amount you wish to place. The staff are great too. France Galop can be justly proud of this jewel in French racing's crown! Vive la France!
Great spot for a lovely walk, although in the time we went it seemed like it was closed, as it was quiet. If I had bought my running shoes, it would have been a great place to run around in.

Auteuil is arguably the world's most sophisticated racecourse. No racecourse in the world is as close to the center of a major city as it is. Moreover, it is just a short walk to Porte d'Auteuil, a public square on the western edge of Paris that closely resembles the center of the city.  The British and Irish may beg to differ, but Auteuil is home to the best jump racing in the world.
Wonderful atmosphere for attending horse racing with your family.
A quiet and restful place
Beautiful place and worth exploring.
A lovely event space for hire!
Beautiful place to do some sport
Nice races in fine location with view on the Eiffel tower
Always enjoy visiting for racing.
Beautiful especially during the summer
Open to visit when no races.
Amazing! Good view...
Top
Cool place on outskirts of Paris.
The view is pleasant
Epic place.
Superb
super

Hippo airport
Super
Top
The great steeplechase: a must see. Very warm welcome, entertainment and catering of all kinds. Friendly atmosphere.  We had a very pleasant Sunday afternoon.

Beautiful place to spend a beautiful sunny day! But it’s a shame that the food trucks are way too expensive, €10 for a cheeseburger without fries which is also made with low-end frozen products, €4 for a crepe… it’s excessive!

A magnificent Hippodrome.  It's the perfect place to get some fresh air, relax and enjoy a superb exotic setting in the heart of Paris.  I went to the Samedis d'Auteuil which takes place every Saturday until June 18 and I loved my experience at the Hippodrome.  Spend an extraordinary day under the Parisian sun watching the races, do free activities like pétanque or ping-pong with friends, chill at sunset with a good bottle and a live orchestra, enjoy food trucks and dance the evening to the electro sounds of the DJ.... a great program which is offered at the moment and which makes it a great atypical Parisian activity.  Good deal: lots of free activities for young and old  A fabulous experience for Saturdays outdoors in the heart of Paris, both chill and festive.

Great outing with the kids, there’s something to keep both young and old occupied! Catering possible on site costs 15€ for a burger with fries or a margarita pizza, there are pancake stands, coffee...etc. Possible to take a little pony ride for 3/4 minutes to get started! Drawing corner, inflatable games and carousel as you wish! For adults' games there are several terminals everywhere!

As someone who is not familiar with horse racing, I really appreciated the atmosphere of the races and the place which has a unique atmosphere. One of the PMU employees explained to us how horse racing betting worked, so we were able to have fun placing bets on the day's races.

We participated in the “Hippodrome en Famille” event (€5/adult and free for children). A great event in addition to having discovered the horse racing world that we knew nothing about, the children were able to participate in several free activities such as pony baptism, carousel ride (unlimited), inflatable structures between 2 horse races.  We had also booked a guided tour of the racecourse (12€/adult and 8€/child) where we were able to approach the racing horses on loan and learn lots of interesting information. I highly recommend the visit, it is very informative for novices. There is a super friendly atmosphere, we had a very good afternoon, very fun and informative. Ps: reserve your entries online because on site it's double ;-).
Steeple Grand Prix 18.5 & 19.5  We happened to be in Paris and stumbled upon the hippodrome.  An unforgettable visit and you have to see a horse race like this!

The Temple of horse racing with obstacles is well worth a visit on a racing day to enjoy the atmosphere and watch the races from its rehabilitated stands, maintaining its ancient architecture. Delicious space to observe the horses and riders before each test, with the reproduction of 2 mythical obstacles and the beautiful sculpture of the horse Al Capone II. The rest, as is usual in a Hippodrome, dedicated to the world of betting. Careful and designed interior gardens.
